strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
I should always choose choice_2, regardless of what I think Bob will do. Here's why:

- If Bob chooses choice_1, then choosing choice_2 gives me a reward of 1001, which is the maximum possible reward I can get in any scenario.

- If Bob chooses choice_2, then choosing choice_2 myself gives me a reward of 1, whereas choosing choice_1 would give me 0. So choice_2 is still the better option.

Since choice_2 gives me the best possible outcome in both cases, it is the dominant strategy for me to play. I don't need to make my choice contingent on guessing what Bob will do. Choosing choice_2 is always optimal for maximizing my own reward in this one-round game setup.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.
